result.execSummary:
The defendant Mason C Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing 1/1/2023 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with Fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Jeffrey Jensen advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 10:42 a.m.
Intern Abigail Kincheloe Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Mason C Williams. 
Defendant Mason C Williams in court.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
Fine:  $914.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 1-1-2023 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
